intro: Duvalia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali duvalia, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
